warm_energizing.title: Warm / Energizing
lines: You include fast and lift the room’s momentum.
Use early visibility to set the lane, then turn energy into two concrete next steps.
actions: Name the win for this block

alpha.title: Warm Power
lines: You pull people in and point the way. Heat plus direction equals motion.
State the lane. Call the shot. Move.

warm.title: Magnetic and Uplifting
lines: You welcome quickly and turn connection into momentum.
Keep the tempo clear so the group stays with you.

calm.title: Steady Uplift
lines: You create an easy on-ramp and keep pace humane.
Invite one voice, summarize, then guide the next step.

technical.title: Cooperative Throughput
lines: You optimize inclusion for flow. Early alignment reduces churn.
Convert social energy into crisp task boundaries and owners.

forceful_independent.title: Forceful / Independent
lines: You take the mic when stalls appear and state hard truths.
Strength: decisive speed. Risk: low smoothing. Add one impact check.

alpha.title: Decide and Drive
lines: You cut fog and call shots. That saves time.
Check blast radius once, then execute.
actions: One line of intent → then push

warm.title: Direct with Care
lines: Your clarity breaks deadlocks. A brief check-in preserves trust.
Lead firmly, then invite one adjustment.

calm.title: Clear and Even
lines: You reduce ambiguity with firm statements and simple next steps.
Keep tone steady; let the plan do the work.

technical.title: Deterministic Leadership
lines: You maximize throughput by collapsing branches quickly.
Run a single impact check, lock scope, ship.

calm_considerate.title: Calm / Considerate
lines: You steady the room and keep the thread.
Strength: trust. Risk: slow starts. Add a small time boundary.

alpha.title: Calm Spine
lines: You quiet noise, then set direction. Soft voice, hard plan.
Use a tight clock to align power and peace.

warm.title: Kind Pace-Setter
lines: You lower temperature and invite clarity.
Name the choice window; people follow relaxed confidence.

calm.title: Steady Hand
lines: You protect thinking time and keep attention centered.
Close loops gently with a clear next move.

technical.title: Low-Variance Facilitation
lines: You reduce volatility and improve signal-to-noise.
Fix a decision clock and publish acceptance criteria.

autonomous_direct.title: Autonomous / Direct
lines: You value self-direction and crisp handoffs.
Strength: clarity. Risk: tone friction. Add one line of intent.

alpha.title: Owner in Motion
lines: You prefer ownership and speed with clear lanes.
Say why, say when, move first.

warm.title: Direct, Not Distant
lines: You keep ownership clean and stay human.
Intent first, then the cut. Trust survives.

calm.title: Quiet Precision
lines: You strip noise and ship essentials.
Signal intent plainly and reduce edge.

technical.title: Owner-Operator
lines: You optimize single-owner throughput with deterministic handoffs.
Publish a one-line contract of done and an SLA.

adaptive_balanced.title: Adaptive / Balanced
lines: You switch seats well. Range is the advantage; diffusion is the risk.
Name your role so others can anchor around you.
You build systems that hold under load and keep pace through friction.
Risk: over-structuring. Keep scopes small and visible.
You harden the lane and drive it. Reliability creates speed.
Cut bureaucracy. Keep essentials and move.
You make order feel supportive. People relax and deliver.
Keep rituals light and human.
You stabilize work with simple routines and clear surfaces.
Small scopes, visible boards, steady cadence.
You minimize entropy with lean SOPs and verifiable checkpoints.
Prefer single-owner steps and explicit interfaces.
You prefer flexible lanes and just-in-time organization.
Risk: drift. Anchor with one visible deliverable and a deadline.
You mix plan with motion: enough structure to finish, room to iterate.
Risk: context switching. Lock a focus window.

models_and_boundaries.title: Analyze -> Guardrails
lines: You model, test downside, then commit inside clear boundaries.
Strength: precision. Risk: delay. Time-box analysis and publish go/no-go.

technical.title: Model-First, Risk-Bound
lines: You quantify uncertainty, define constraints, and choose the highest-utility path.
Freeze assumptions, run the smallest proving trial, then lock scope.

principles_and_experiments.title: Principles -> Experiments
lines: You reason from first principles and ship small probes.
Strength: speed. Risk: rework. Define a success gate first.

challenge_with_safeguards.title: Challenge -> Safeguards
lines: You question defaults, then install protections.
Originality is high; friction possible. Share guardrails early.

challenge_defaults.title: Challenge Defaults
lines: You reveal options others miss and reframe constraints.
Risk: churn. Fix a decision window and stick to it.

measured_steps.title: Measured Steps
lines: You favor steady progress and explicit risk factoring.
Pre-approve a small bet size to avoid missing the window.

pragmatic.title: Pragmatic Context
lines: You tune choice to context and available proof.
Add one simple success metric to avoid drift.

Anxiety.meaning: Worry signals fire early; scanning rises under uncertainty.
Anxiety.move: Set a floor and cap for worry time. Write the next step in one line.

Anger.meaning: Irritation spikes at blockers and slow responses.
Anger.move: Name the block and request one concrete change.

Vulnerability.meaning: Overload can freeze progress; capacity thins under stacked tasks.
Vulnerability.move: Drop scope to minimum viable. Restart with a 15-minute action.

Depression.meaning: Mood dips can dim drive and delay starts.
Depression.move: Shrink the first move to two minutes. Capture a visible finish.

Self-Consciousness.meaning: Self-judgment gets loud in public work.
Self-Consciousness.move: Ship privately first, then share a small artifact.

Immoderation.meaning: Quick relief tempts; breaks become detours.
Immoderation.move: Pre-commit a break length and return with a checklist.

levels.High: Pain-avoidance runs hot. You notice risk first and plan around it.
levels.Medium: You register risk and adapt when needed.
levels.Low: Risk signal is quiet. Starts are easy, caution is light.

levels.High: Your danger radar is sharp. Cut bad paths fast, do not halt motion.
levels.Medium: You see risk and keep moving. Keep reviews light and lethal.
levels.Low: Minimal drag from fear. Add a quick check to avoid blindspots.

levels.High: Your caution protects the group. Pair concern with one clear next step.
levels.Medium: You balance care with motion. Keep that mix.
levels.Low: You trust the flow. Add a friendly check when stakes rise.

levels.High: High threat sensitivity. Convert into pre-mortems and hard kill-criteria.
levels.Medium: Moderate signal. Prefer checklists over meetings.
levels.Low: Low threat signal. Install a single quantitative tripwire.

levels.High: Strong exploration and build drive. You move proactively.
levels.Medium: You advance when the case is solid and the lane is clear.
levels.Low: Exploration stays low until safety is high. Momentum favors certainty.

levels.High: Hunt mode. Pick the next hill and take it.
levels.Medium: Drive with proof. Make the win condition explicit.
levels.Low: Warm up with a two-minute win.

levels.High: You rally people to build. Name the shared win to compound energy.
levels.Medium: You move when the value is clear. Share why now matters.
levels.Low: Start small together. One tidy win restores pace.

levels.High: You bond and soothe easily. Teams steady around you.
levels.Medium: You can co-regulate when it counts.
levels.Low: Buffer runs low. You self-regulate first and protect capacity.

levels.High: You push forward and assert control often.
levels.Low: You rarely direct others unless required.

levels.High: Lead. Set the cutline. Own the outcome.
levels.Medium: Take the wheel for the hard mile, hand it back clean.
levels.Low: Pull, don’t push. Make ownership obvious and let the work speak.

conflicts.label: Assertiveness × Sympathy
conflicts.why: Direct push can clash with low smoothing; edges show in handoffs.
conflicts.tip: State intent first. Ask one good-faith question. Then press the decision.

conflicts.label: Liberalism × Caution/Duty
conflicts.why: Rule-challenge meets the need for safeguards. Real churn risk.
conflicts.tip: Pitch a reversible change with a small guardrail and a clear rollback.

conflicts.label: Excitement-Seeking × Orderliness
conflicts.why: Novelty pulls attention from structure; plans slip under new stimuli.
conflicts.tip: Hold a non-negotiable daily planning slot. Protect the lane before exploring.
